result.execSummary:
The defendant Cedric Buchanan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank pursuant to 973.048 of Wisconsin statutes. Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV and DNA surcharges, bail to apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

**06/29/17- Judge Jeffrey Kremers**
JOC's shall be amended to reflect 37 days of sentence credit on count one and 38 days of sentence credit on count two.

superMiscConds.notes:
- NO CONTACT with the victim.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.
- Successfully complete any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

- Participate in an AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with controlled substances, except for those prescribed by a physician.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Court found defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.

**06/29/17- Judge Jeffrey Kremers**
JOC's shall be amended to reflect 37 days of sentence credit on count one and 38 days of sentence credit on count two.
Concurrent with: Count 1

Attorney Christopher Ertl for Atty Jason Canfield in court, defendant Cedric Buchanan not in court, in custody. Defendants appearance wavied.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court neglected to sentence the defendant on count 2 at yesterdays sentencing. Case recalled. 
Sentencing continued. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction concurrent with count 1. 

The court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges for them.
received and filed; Character Letters.

Defendant Cedric Buchanan in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Cedric Buchanan in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  Additional statement/s by: Brend B.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 42 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 14 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 16 MONTHS with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to participate in an AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
        Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with controlled
        substances, except for those prescribed by a physician.
     *  Defendant to have no contact with the victim.
     *   Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV and DNA surcharges,  bail to
         apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a 
         percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended      
         supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin 
        statutes.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.

Defendant Cedric Buchanan in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Third call of the Jury Trial. State's witness has failed to appear. State renewed request to adjourn the trial. Court GRANTED state's request. Defense motion to dismiss DENIED. Case set for a Final Pretrial & Jury Trial date in branch 36. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cedric Buchanan in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. Discussion regarding state's witness. State requested a Body Attachment and an Adjournment of the Jury Trial date. Defense motioned to dismiss. Defense motion DENIED. Court GRANTED adjournment, but did not order the Body Attachment at this time. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Prior to completion of calling of this case, state advised court that their victim/witness advocate has regained communication with the witness. State is now ready to proceed, and is no longer requesting the body attachment. Case is passed to 1:30 PM.

Copy previously given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case passed to address court calendar.

Received & Filed, Amended Information. 
COUNT 1: Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm With Intent To Cause Bodily Harm), Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of A Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(2), 939.50(3)(i), 973.055(1), and 939.63(1)(c), a class I Felony. 
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Use of A Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.63(1)(a), and 973.055(1) a class B Misdemeanor.

State requests a court date for arraignment. Court granted. All bail conditions remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Arraignment scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
